key_channel_insights.line_content: 96.26% of Air China itineraries were unavailable on OTAs last week, marking a 2.20-point weekly increase and a 4.27-point monthly rise.
MSE listings were missing for 59.5% of itineraries, yet offered discounts in 21.99% of cases with an average 0.48% undercut.
GDS showed no matching website offers for 97.68% of itineraries last week, with only 1.71% carrying a modest 0.04% premium and negligible discounts.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: In the latest week, 96.26% of Air China itineraries were not available on OTAs, up 2.20 points week-over-week and 4.27 points month-over-month.
Price parity fell to 2.55%, down 1.52 points week-over-week and 2.45 points month-over-month, indicating fewer matched fares.
OTA fares were higher on 1.18% of itineraries with a 0.04% average premium, while discounted listings remained negligible at 0.02%.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Air China listings were absent on OTAs for 96.26% of routes last week, reflecting a 2.20-point weekly increase and a 4.27-point monthly rise.
Price parity occurred on 2.55% of routes last week, down 1.52 points week-over-week and 2.45 points month-over-month.
OTA offered higher fares on 1.18% of routes last week, decreasing by 0.67 points week-over-week and 1.76 points month-over-month, with an average 0.04% premium.
OTA discounts were minimal at 0.02% share last week, down 0.01 points week-over-week, with average discounts under 0.1%.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul routes saw 97.32% absence on OTAs last week (up 1.56 points W/W, 3.01 points M/M), while higher-priced listings remained low at 0.70% share.
Long-haul absence reached 82.84% last week (up 10.65 points W/W, 20.34 points M/M), as both parity and higher-price shares contracted.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For CN-origin routes, 97.38% were unavailable on OTAs last week (up 1.44 points W/W, 2.41 points M/M), with negligible higher-pricing incidence.
Non-CN routes had 75.87% OTA absence last week (up 16.20 points W/W, 38.92 points M/M) and a significant 22.22% share of higher fares despite a 12.72-point weekly decline.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in itineraries were 97.65% absent on OTAs last week (up 2.14 points W/W, 5.13 points M/M), with just 0.78% showing higher OTA fares.
Far-out itineraries had 93.70% absence on OTAs last week (up 2.07 points W/W, 2.66 points M/M) and a 1.88% share of higher fares in early bookings.

mse_highlights.line_content: MSE listings were unavailable for 59.5% of itineraries last week, reflecting a 25.4% week-over-week increase and a 42.2% rise versus the prior month.
In 21.99% of itineraries, MSE fares undercut the website by an average 0.48%, maintaining a consistent discount level over recent periods.
Less than 0.3% of listings showed higher MSE fares, with an average markup of only 0.07% last week.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Last-week no-offer rate stood at 59.52%, up from 34.08% prior week and 17.30% month-ago.
Parity occurred in 18.23% of cases last week, down 4.9% week-over-week and 5.1% month-over-month.
Lower-priced offers appeared in 21.99% of itineraries last week, down 20.4% week-over-week and 36.8% versus the prior month.
Higher-priced listings comprised 0.25% of itineraries last week, a modest decline versus previous periods.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul routes mirrored overall trends, with 59.8% missing listings, 22.1% lower fares averaging a 0.48% discount, and parity at 17.8% last week.
Long-haul saw 55.98% missing listings, a higher parity share of 23.25%, and lower fares in 20.54% of cases with a 0.40% average discount.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: China outbound routes had 59.25% missing listings, 22.52% lower fares at an average 0.49% discount, and parity at 17.98% last week.
Non-China O&Ds experienced 64.65% missing listings, only 12.42% lower fares with a 0.08% discount, and a higher markup incidence of 0.32% averaging 0.11%.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in itineraries saw 74.71% missing listings, 23.47% lower fares averaging a 0.53% discount, and minimal parity at 1.62% last week.
Far-out bookings showed 30.64% missing listings, strong parity at 49.83%, and 19.19% lower fares with a 0.35% average discount.

gds_highlights.line_content: GDS showed 97.7% of ODs with no matching website offers last week, a 1.5-point weekly increase and 2.4-point monthly rise.
1.7% of ODs on GDS priced above the website last week, carrying a 0.04% average premium, although incidence is down by nearly 1 point from the prior week.
Instances where GDS undercut the website were below 0.02% of ODs, with an average discount of 0.13%, remaining flat month-over-month.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Last week 97.68% of itineraries were unavailable on GDS vs website, up 1.53 points week-over-week and 2.39 points month-over-month.
Only 0.60% of itineraries matched website pricing on GDS last week, down 0.54 points week-over-week and 0.60 points month-over-month.
1.71% of itineraries were priced higher on GDS last week, carrying a 0.04% average premium, with frequency down 0.97 points vs the prior week.
Just 0.02% of itineraries were cheaper on GDS last week, averaging a 0.13% discount and showing minimal change vs prior periods.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: GDS lacked 98.27% of short-haul offers last week; 1.11% carried a 0.04% premium and undercuts were effectively zero.
GDS missed 90.50% of long-haul offers last week; 9.28% showed a 0.04% premium on average, with negligible lower-priced cases.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Within China, 99.49% of itineraries were absent on GDS last week and 0.51% matched website prices, with no recorded premium or discount instances.
For non-China origins, GDS lacked 64.44% of offers; 32.70% carried a 0.04% premium and 2.54% matched website pricing last week.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in fares were unavailable on GDS for 98.74% of itineraries; 1.21% showed a 0.04% premium and discounts were negligible.
Far-out booking offers were missing on GDS for 95.72% of itineraries; 2.65% carried a 0.03% premium and 1.64% matched website pricing last week.
